availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William J. White (Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of William White and Mary White. Married to Mildred Frances Riddle White in Shelby County, Kentucky on April 7, 1853. Father of Ann B. White, William White and Thomas E. White. Laborer in Franklin County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Shelby County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin, District 2, p. 88A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby, District 2, p. 74.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin, Frankfort, p. 139B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film #000259291.
